38637544.name: Sylvetica
38637544.comment:
>>38637081

You don'r really have to take off your headgear—not for the reason that it's ridiculous, actually. No one thought they'd catch on at first: similar equipment started as peripherals for existing computing devices, but when larger companies jumped on board, the technology went along faster than imagined, not for the purpose of virtual reality gaming so much as for the promise of hands-free computing. A few years later, no one bats an eye at Google Glass and its ilk. You see them just about everywhere; not a lot when people are on the job, at least when it comes to retail, but often on the street, and almost always in your classes.

Granted, your setup is just a little bit chunkier than most. You remove it for the time being anyway, just because it's starting to bother you. You're heavier than in Broken Sky Online, not that you're overweight, but that out here, you can't jump as high as you are tall. Still a bit disoriented, you find yourself checking your corners a bit as you make your way back to your room.

As you enter, you decide to forget about the whole issue of the LAN club, realizing that it's just about that time now. It probably wouldn't have been terribly exciting.

> Relax, and stretch a bit.
> Take a quick nap before the raid.
> Text and see what Eric is up to.
> Log onto BSO.

38640142.comment:
>>38639275

“Did the game update earlier?” You ask, as the four of you make your way inside. The message board console is gone, as is the entire bulletin board area; you notice that that wall has definitely been replaced, and there are no tables on the side of the room. There's a player playing bartender behind the counter, with waist-length hair and what you think is the maximum avatar bust size. You continue, sitting down at the only remaining table large enough to accommodate the rest of your group. “What was that about?”

“Yeah, people are talking. No one's noticed anything different at all.” Ayla says. “There's no release notes.”

“I'm thinkin' it was mostly server-side stuff. How the hell else are they gonna roll out an update like that while people are still logged in?” Donnel says. “I got back on a little bit ago. We got a warning on our UI, and that's about it.”

“That's foreboding.” Aelriss sighs.. “Anyway, what about the Sanctum? We going in blind?”

“Beyond what the fortune-teller gave me, I don't really have anything else.” You suggest. “This game has a way of keeping us in the dark. Ayla?”

“No, you're about right. Even with a group of ten, we'll have to take the first couple of fights cautiously to see what the place is going to throw at us.” The Technician nods. “Likewise, with that kind of manpower, there's no sense leaving any stone unturned when it comes to searching the place for loot and technology.”

“And Celestial Gems.” Aelriss adds.

“So, uh. Is she going to be a problem?” Donnel speaks quietly, pointing at Tatsumaki, who frowns at him. “What with the mute business.”

The walk toward the lower branch is quiet. At the city's gates, you rendezvous with another group of three: you recognize Andor, standing alongside two unknown members of the Crimson Guardians. One of them approaches you—strong features, full plate armor, a claymore, and a red cape, with wavy hair and a bit of stubble around his chin—extending a hand in greeting.

“You're Ascheritte?” He asks. “Kainzo. Liza told me you'd be leading your group?”

“Well, actually, Nel is.” You look over your shoulder, but Nel waves you off.

“Nah, it's cool. I got my turn already.” He says. “I trust you, Ashe.”

“Right, then.” Kainzo says. He pauses, and gestures to the girl at his side: blonde hair, with a tight-fitting hooded cloak, and a pair of gauntlets and high greaves that share a wicked spiked motif. “This is Vyx, one of our new members.”

“Hello.” She smiles. “It's good to meet you.”

“Ayla, he's the one that found out the trick with the statue?” Andor asks. “I recognize him.”

“Yep. Ascheritte knows what he's doing, no need to worry.” Ayla says. “He, Tatsumaki, and Donnel are their heavy-hitters. Aelriss is running support duty, and Nel is, uhm.”

“Diversionary tactics.” Aelriss responds, eliciting a groan from Nel.

> [[ Continued ]]

“Well, I'm glad to meet the lot of you. I'm Andor, second-in-command of the Disposable Heroes.” He grins. “I'm sure you've seen me around town here and there.”

“Of course.” Donnel says. “Most of you don't need an introduction, really. I'm surprised to see so many Alliance officers in one place—glad to be a part of it all, that is.”

"Well, whatever the case." Andor says. "I'm damn excited to be a part of this run. All told, it's refreshing after all the Nameless damage control I've done in the last couple of hours. Has your group figured out anything about the update?"

“Nope. Hey, where's Liza?” Nel pouts. “She too good for us?”

“She's busy. I can tell she contemplated coming, but I insisted it wasn't necessary.” Kainzo says. “I'll be acting as the leader of our party.”

“How are we dividing loot?” You ask. The ten of you are moving as a crowd, until you see the ancient cathedral come into view beyond rocks and falling water. The Construct Guardians nearby are dead, and you think you can hear sound from inside.

“A split between the affiliated parties seems the fairest, does it not?” Kainzo asks. “Between us, we've Crimson Guardians, Writ Keepers, Disposable Heroes, and your band, Ascheritte.”

What will you do?
> Other

“Split between our four allegiances and subdivide further?” You ask. The ten of you make your way up the steps in formation. You need more Celestial Gems. “There's five of just us. That's not exactly in our favor.”

“Isn't that the price you pay for your individual status?” Kainzo shrugs. “We—at least, the Gurdians—share a portion of what we earn with the members of our guild. If you're suggesting we profit more than you as individuals...”

“Nah.” Nel folds his arms. “Keep feeding Celestial Gems to your leader, like she tells you to.”

“You're right. Issue is, I don't need to.” Kainzo says, unamused. “I already have one.”

“Wait, what?” Donnel asks.

“Are you quite done, then?” Kainzo continues, bearing down on a silent Nel.

“Oi, quit it, you two.” Ayla hisses. “Nel, you're acting like an ass.”

“I didn't know there were more Artifacts around.” Aelriss says, attempting to clear the air.
 
“We've attempted to use discovered Altars in the lower branches, so as not to generate hype. I'd be glad to tell you all about it...” Kainzo smiles, turning away from her to face Nel. “...later.”

You enter in time to catch the end of a battle. Gathered around a cathedral pew, there's a band of five Nameless licking their wounds; you see a fresh Obsidian Pegasus corpse nearby, surrounded by stone soldiers. You recognize three of the Nameless: the three girls, identical in all aspects but hair color. You fought them here before. Ahead, you see the Sanctum door, as well as the underground waterway and the path to Velika's Tomb. There's stairs to your left and right that lead to the upper walkway and the study.

"Nameless." Donnel says, reaching for his straight sword. "I remember those three. Are they back already?"

"Ah, those were the girls from outside, with Kalim." Aelriss frowns.

"Let's wait by the doors." Donnel says. "We can kill them when they try to leave."

"Woah, woah." Andor says. "We're not in a PVP zone. Don't try to stir shit."

What will you do?

38642359.name: Sylvetica

>>38642009

“Agreed,” You suggest. “It's not worth dealing with them right now. Follow me.”

You and Kainzo push your way to the front of the group. He glances over at you briefly, and you merely nod in response.

“Don't even think about following us.” Donnel says, glaring at the Nameless as you pass.

A set of small steps elevates the front end of the Cathedral toward its podium, where any speaker would stand high above their congregation. Behind it, the massive Sanctum door, where the Keystone must fit. You lift it, and it rises out of your hands, carried upward on a cloud of brilliant white light that guides it to the center.

The door slowly opens, and the ten of you pace backwards to make room. Ahead, you see the Sanctum.

A spiral staircase leads upward, and there's a distant sound of metal scratching on glass, rhythmic like footsteps. Through the translucent floor, you can see down into the underground waterway. For a moment, you feel as if you're being watched. Ahead, a long hallway, with a ceiling still many times as high as you are tall. Doors line the walls, and you see stationary, humanoid statues, crafted from durable-looking metals and luminescent gems.

At the far end, there's one that towers above all the others, a single red eye glowing in the center of its head.

> [[ Ancient Cathedral: Inner Sanctum // PVP Disabled ]]

A wisp floats by you, interrupting your movement and Kainzo's, and leaving a projected menu where it passes.

> [[ Sanctum of Kjorikos // 10 Players ]]
> [[ With a large party, the rewards will be higher. Rarer items are available. ]]
> [[ However, the dungeon difficulty will be scaled up greatly to accomodate. ]]
> [[ Tackle this area with ten players? Y/N ]]

“This place looks pretty tough.” Andor says. “We could always split into groups of five, just to make sure we can clean everything out.”

> Write-in

38642658.name: Sylvetica
38642658.comment:
>>38642359

“This place looks pretty tough.” Andor says. “We could always split into groups of five, just to make sure we can clean everything out.”

“Split, and we lose out on the best loot in exchange for an easier ride.” Kainzo responds. “At least, that's what I think it says.”

“I'm up for risking it.” You suggest. “Though risk assessment hasn't always been my strong suit.”

“Tell me about it.” Ayla folds her arms.

“Any other opinions?” You ask.

“I agree, if it counts.” Kainzo's finger is hovering over the button. “No going back, then?”

You nod.

> [[ Difficulty set. ]]

“Uhm, guys?” Vyx says. “Twelve o'clock?”

“Yep, incoming!” You hear Donnel shout, and there's the sound of weapons being drawn. A rumbling from straight ahead grows louder, as the army of statues is roused to action all at once. They outnumber you at least two to one, and are faster than before, stone bodies and crude weapons caked in jagged sheets and peaks of tourmaline crystal, decorated with jewelry and alchemical catalysts.

At the back, the cyclops takes a heavy step forward.

“Oh, hell. That's a lot.” Aelriss says.

“Damn, they weren't kidding.” Ayla produces another handheld explosive from her UI, assuming a fighting stance. “Let's get to it, then! Now's no time to freeze up!”

They're almost upon you already, but you've got a moment to react.

[[ 1 ]]
> Have Ayla try and blast through them.
> Have Ayla hold off on the explosive.

[[ 2 ]]
> Defer to Kainzo's orders.
> Have the close combatants hold the line.
> Fight as a large group and try to thin their numbers.
> Aim for the larger target in the back.

38642975.name: Sylvetica
38642975.comment:
>>38642658

“Ayla, how many of those do you have?!” You shout over the sounds of charging footsteps, stone on heavy glass, jeweled feet scratching beneath.

“Three! They're a little expensive, but I think this is a fair occasion!” She shouts.

“Blast 'em, then!” Nel shouts. You watch it sail overhead, landing dead center in the group. Jagged, purple rings of light ripple outward, then there's a large blast, a burst of force, and an expanding cloud of energy that bathes you in heat and silhouettes the oncoming attackers.

> [[ Relic Watcher was defeated. ]]
> [[ Relic Watcher was defeated. ]]
> [[ Relic Watcher was defeated. ]]

They're scattered. A wall of smoke hits the group before the Watchers do, and there's the sound of bits of stone hitting the floor around you, shimmering tourmaline dust hanging in the air. You hear Kainzo shout. “Ranged attackers, focus on one target!”

A beat—are there any ranged attackers?

“Me!” Vyx half-shouts, half-squeaks from behind you, cartwheeling to the side, away from the group. She's holding two strange-looking Casters in her hands, and unleashing a hellish rain of red bolts on the crowd. They fire faster than any weapons you've seen so far, and at first you see her taking single shots at each of the targets in the group, hitting much more accurately than should be possible while upside-down and moving: then, she begins aiming for the more weakened targets. One or two break rank to chase after her.

Without Ayla's guns in her hands, you've only one ranged attacker. Which complicates what's going to happen next.

> [[ Continued ]]

> [[ 77 ]]

“Donnel!” You shout. Kainzo looks over, and calls out as soon as he sees you start to move.

“Aelriss, take his place!” The Guardian says, pressing forward for room to take a wide swing of his claymore.

“What, me?” Aelriss yells, moving forward. “Going!”

You're not sure how to activate the skill, thinking of Concussive Strike: then, you feel it. Guided by your blade, you surge forward, crossing the gap between yourself and Donnel faster than you thought yourself able, and intercepting the Watcher that threatens to break your line with an immensely powerful strike. You catch it in the air as it dives for him, and feel your blade bite into its stone body. There's a lash of flame, a heat within that melts away crystal surrounding the immediate impact site: then, a mighty burst of force that launches the stone monster away, shattering it against the wall.

[[ Ascheritte defeated Relic Watcher. ]]
[[ Kainzo defeated Relic Watcher. ]]
[[ Kainzo defeated Relic Watcher. ]]

Another blast of force from over your shoulder, and you see a crystalline body skid helplessly down the hallway, propelled by Tatsumaki's punch.

[[ Tatsumaki defeated Relic Watcher. ]]

“Damnit!” You hear Nel shout, and turn to see him scrambling away. “I'm doing literally no damage!”

“Hey, a little help?” Vyx yells, kiting a group of three around the area. She's got her back to others, and is quickly running out of space.

“Ayla,” Kainzo barks, caster fire sailing overhead. “Clear her some space!”

[[ Vyx defeated Relic Watcher. ]]
[[ Andor defeated Relic Watcher. ]]

“We can beat them! Keep on it!” Ayla says, casters raised. Far behind, the cyclops draws closer and picks up speed. The group of Watchers is thinning—down to just more than ten, but they're spreading out.

Then, you spy a shadow, as something leaps toward you from behind.

> [[ 83 ]]

You duck low, maneuvering to one side. A few inches shorter, and a crystal-caked blade would have bisected you. Luckily, you're too fast for something like that. The stone soldier pauses, empty eyes looking into yours briefly, before you bring your weapon around to decapitate it, flames licking at the point of impact.

Well, you try, but your sword stops at the neck. It attempts to pierce you with its own blade, but you curve your body nimbly to the side and finish it off with another swing—god damn.

> [[ Ascheritte defeated Relic Watcher. ]]

“Ow, ow!” Vyx is scrambling in your direction, whining more loudly with each step. Her form flickers again, and she twirls around, arms outstretched, firing a blossom of bolts in all directions. “Where's my team?”

“I'm trying!” Ayla shouts. “These guys have a lot of health for trash!”

> [[ Tatsumaki defeated Relic Watcher. ]]

“Armor, too!” You hear Nel's voice from one side of the room, but don't see him immediately.

> [[ Ayla defeated Relic Watcher. ]]
> [[ Vyx defeated Relic Watcher. ]]

“Aelriss, Tatsumaki!” Donnel says, leaping to his feet. “Can you clean up behind her?”

“What do you people even want me to do?” Aelriss asks, ducking low to avoid a pair of overhead swings, and quickly moving out of the fray on all fours. Eunoia's fluttering about overhead, whistling a merry tune.

> [[ Andor defeated Relic Watcher. ]]

“Kainzo, Ashe!” Andor yells. “Boss is closing in fast!”

Looks like there's six or seven left. You're hanging in there.

> Have Nel distract the boss.
> Clear space for Vyx to kite the boss while you clean up.
> Go after the pair behind Aelriss.
> Give an order. (Write-in)

> [[ 98 – One Failed Roll: Enhanced Effect ]]

“Duck low!” As you charge forward, you hear a distant, ghostly sound of a cavalcade of horses, echoic hoofbeats that herald your approach. The gold of your armor lights up as you charge forward, and a pair of ghostly, golden wings flash into existence at your back—for just a brief instant—as you leap into the air over a diving Aelriss, wasting no movement, losing no energy. It feels like someone's thrown you, and you capitalize on the opportunity, putting your weapon through the chesf of a Relic Watcher as you land.

> [[ Ascheritte defeated Relic Watcher. ]]

The other towers over you, but Kainzo moves to your side, putting a claymore between the two of you, and carrying into a wicked horizontal swing.

> [[ Kainzo defeated Relic Watcher. ]]

“Die, die, die!” Vyx shouts, spraying bolts at the last pair of Watchers, who are locked in combat with Tatsumaki. With just a brief instant to clear your head, you look for the boss, and notice Nel leading it in circles around the area.

> [[ Vyx defeated Relic Watcher. ]]
> [[ Tatsumaki defeated Relic Watcher. ]]

As the last of them falls, the golem stops and stomps in place, reticulated cracks spreading out from the glass beneath it. Nel's stride is broken, and he turns to watch.

“What the? Is it... trying to break through?” Kainzo asks.

The next move comes without warning. It leans forward with newfound speed, and a searing beam surges forth from the red eye, cutting across Nel's chest and sending him spiraling to the ground a few feet away. It scorches a trail on the floor as it sweeps toward the rest of the party, and the golem begins to stomp towards the center of the group.

“It's gonna hit all of us!” Vyx shouts.

“Go low, boys!” Donnel calls.

“No, jump it!” Aelriss responds.

> Try to get closer, and let the beam sweep overhead.
> Try to get away until it stops.
> Try to reach the stairs and watch.
> Other

38644483.name: Sylvetica
38644483.comment:
>>38644123

“Ascherite, move!” Ayla says. But the light hasn't died in your armor yet, and you feel as if there's motion still stored within you. You use it to bring yourself forward, sliding across the floor on your knees a distance; the golem's head moves to follow you, and you feel the heat of the beam just off your scalp.

“Nel!” You shout, closing the distance with the golem. “You okay?”

“I won't be after another hit from that!” He struggles to his feet, not taking his eyes off the golem. “I'd ask you to make it stop, but I'm literally useless!”

“It's not you. Your weapons aren't doing enough damage.” Kainzo responds. The Guardian moves left, then right, gleaming claymore in both hands. “If you don't think you're doing enough, try to find another angle of attack! That goes for all of you! Ascheritte, with me! Ranged attackers, find a position and DPS!”

He's able to make it into range, cape fluttering, and cut a shallow gash in the golem's crystalline leg before having to dodge again, the beam firing wildly from its rotating head. Then, a flicker, as a transparent image mirrors his latest movements, cutting deeper than before.

“We need a plan!” You call, taking a stance lower to the ground. “It's not stopping!”

> [[ Continued ]]
